IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE SAFE, FUN, INNOVATIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS, USING THE NATIONAL BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA OUTDOOR PROGRAM AS A BASIS FOR TEACHING LIFE LONG SKILLS AND INSTILLING ETHICAL BEHAVIORS IN YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN BEGINNING AT THE AGE OF 6 AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE AGE OF 21. IT IS THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION TO DELIVER THE BOY SCOUT PROGRAM TO THE SIX NORTHERN AND EASTERN COUNTIES PROVIDING YOUTH IN ITS SERVICE AREA WITH ORGANIZED OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO TEACH SELF RELIANCE AND INSTILL LIFELONG VALUES THAT ENCOURAGE YOUNG ADULTS TO MAKE ETHICAL CHOICES THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROVIDE SAFE, FUN, INNOVATIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS, USING THE NATIONAL BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA OUTDOOR PROGRAM AS A BASIS FOR TEACHING LIFE LONG SKILLS AND INSTILLING ETHICAL BEHAVIORS IN YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN BEGINNING AT THE AGE OF 6 AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE AGE OF 21. IT IS THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION TO DELIVER THE BOY SCOUT PROGRAM TO THE SIX NORTHERN AND EASTERN COUNTIES PROVIDING YOUTH IN ITS SERVICE AREA WITH ORGANIZED OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO TEACH SELF RELIANCE AND INSTILL LIFELONG VALUES THAT ENCOURAGE YOUNG ADULTS TO MAKE ETHICAL CHOICES THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES.
IRS990.Description: KATAHDIN SCOUT RESERVATION AND CAMP ROOSEVELT PROVIDED A SUMMER CAMPING EXPERIENCE FOR NEARLY 1,000 YOUTH. DURING THEIR ATTENDANCE AT CAMP, YOUTH LEARNED OUTDOOR SKILLS AND ENGAGED IN TEAMWORK ACTIVITIES. MANY LEARNED TO SWIM OR WATER SAFETY SKILLS. OTHERS DEVELOPED CONFIDENCE WHILE NAVIGATING A ROPES COURSE, DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR THAT PURPOSE. MAINE HIGH ADVENTURE BASE PROVIDED A CAMPING EXPERIENCE TO SEVERAL HUNDRED YOUTH. WHILE CAMPING OR HIKING, THESE YOUTH LEARNED TEAMWORK AND SELF RELIANCE AS THEY PLANNED AND EXECUTED A WILDERNESS ADVENTURE TREK. CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O CUB SCOUT DAY CAMPS PROVIDED SEVERAL DAYS OF AGE APPROPRIATE OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES FOR YOUTH AGED 6 TO 10. DURING THESE DAYS THE PARTICIPANTS TOOK PART IN ACTIVITIES RANGING FROM SWIMMING TO CRAFTS AND LEARNED PERSONAL SKILLS AS WELL AS TEAMWORK SKILLS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COUNCIL ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF FASC 740 AND SUBSECTIONS (FORMERLY FASB INTERPRETATION NO. 48, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES) ON JANUARY 1, 2009. UNDER FASC 740 AND SUBSECTIONS, AN ORGANIZATION MUST RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT ASSOCIATED WITH TAX TAKEN FOR TAX RETURN PURPOSES WHEN IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED. THE ADOPTION OF FASC 740 AND SUBSECTIONS HAD NO MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE COUNCIL'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COUNCIL'S INCOME TAX FILINGS ARE SUBJECT TO AUDIT BY VARIOUS TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE COUNCIL'S OPEN AUDIT PERIODS ARE 2007 - 2010. ANY INTEREST OR PENALTIES ASSESSED TO THE COUNCIL ARE RECORDED IN OTHER EXPENSES. NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES WERE ACCRUED AS OF JANUARY 1, 2009, AS A RESULT OF THE ADOPTION OF THE PROVISION OF FASC 740 AND SUBSECTIONS. FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2010 AND 2009 THERE WERE NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: THIRD PARTY USED TO PROCESS NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS
Form990ScheduleMPartII.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE M, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 32B
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY USES A BROKERAGE FIRM TO RECEIVE AND SELL ANY GIFTS OF SECURITIES.

IT IS THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION TO DELIVER THE BOY SCOUT PROGRAM TO THE SIX NORTHERN AND EASTERN COUNTIES PROVIDING YOUTH IN ITS SERVICE AREA WITH ORGANIZED OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO TEACH SELF RELIANCE AND INSTILL LIFELONG VALUES THAT ENCOURAGE YOUNG ADULTS TO MAKE ETHICAL CHOICES THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES.

CUB SCOUT DAY CAMPS PROVIDED SEVERAL DAYS OF AGE APPROPRIATE OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES FOR YOUTH AGED 6 TO 10. DURING THESE DAYS THE PARTICIPANTS TOOK PART IN ACTIVITIES RANGING FROM SWIMMING TO CRAFTS AND LEARNED PERSONAL SKILLS AS WELL AS TEAMWORK SKILLS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO AND REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND AUDIT COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. ADDITIONALLY, UPON THE RECEIPT OF THE FINAL FORM 990, THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND IS PRESENTED AT A REGULAR EXECUTIVE BOARD MEETING TO OBTAIN THEIR APPROVAL FOR FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.
ALL EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS' COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
ALL EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS' COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
DISCLOSURE OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
